intro: Ludwigia octandra, commonly known as the red Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of streams, thriving in moist to aquatic environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often reddish in color, adding visual interest to wetland landscapes. Ludwigia octandra is also cultivated as an ornamental plant in water gardens and pond settings.
